meanings.definition: Delay or prevent (someone or something) by obstructing them.
meanings.sent1: The fallen tree impeded our path through the forest.
meanings.sent2: Heavy traffic can impede the flow of vehicles on the highway.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn jar lid seemed to impede my efforts to open it.
meanings.sent4: Her fear of failure impeded her journey towards success.
meanings.sent5: The thick fog impeded visibility, making it hard to see ahead.

meanings.definition: Hinder or slow down the progress of.
meanings.sent1: The construction work impeded the completion of the road project.
meanings.sent2: Lack of funding can impede the development of new technologies.
meanings.sent3: The sleepy kitten playfully tried to impede its owner's work.
meanings.sent4: Negative thoughts can impede one's ability to move forward in life.
meanings.sent5: The tangled wires impeded the smooth operation of the machine.
